ygData.subject: Re: The Fishing Pole can be Tinkered!
ygData.msgSnippet: I never said the fishing pole was a rare drop.  The spyglass is most definitely a rare drop.  Things are only worth as much as they are useful.  People don t
ygData.messageBody:
I never said the fishing pole was a rare drop. The spyglass is most definitely
a rare drop. Things are only worth as much as they are useful. People don't
collect things in everquest. They buy things to use. I don't know how good
the spyglass is, but if it isn't that good then it would not be worth that
much.

Philip Terry wrote:

> From: "Philip Terry" <pjt006@...>
>
> Hey again,
>
> If the fishing pole were a very rare item in the game (1 out of 400 drops),
> then that would make it worth more money. But if Salvador was including
> them in his spyglasses cheaply, then he had to making them (or being given
> them by some unknown source). I believe that the fishing pole is a real
> tinkerable item for this reason and that Salavador (if he can be trusted)
> told us the cork isn't in the formula (thus, he knows it).

--Eron
aeron@...

from Seinfeld:

"I thought you were happy-go-lucky."
"No, no, no, I'm not happy, I'm not lucky, and I don't go. If anything,
I'm sad-stop-unlucky."
- Naomi and Jerry, in "The Bubble Boy"
